Your brand is a mark of your unique value, so giving it more visibility helps you stand out, gives more credibility to your professional resume, and opens up a world of opportunities.&nbsp;pnnnnpYou might already be thinking about your brand in your daily life, from the way you interact with your peers to the way you present yourself at networking events. But as we know, for a brand to be truly successful, it has to exist on the internet.&nbsp;pnnnnpBut how do you even emstartem building your personal brand in an online space where everyone is trying to do the same The answer lies in choosing the right digital tools and platforms that help you hit your branding goals. There are thousands of tools, and not all of them will be right for your needs, which can be daunting.&nbsp;pnnnnpThat’s why, to help you in your branding efforts, we gathered the best online tools to streamline this process, ensuring your personal brand reflects your true Unique Value Proposition (USP) and gets the visibility it deserves.pnnnnh2 class=wp-block-headingstrongWebsite creation toolsstrongh2nnnnpYour website is the cornerstone of your brand. This is a given if you offer services or have an eCommerce platform, but if your brand centers around your online persona, you might be wondering whether you even need a website if you’re maintaining your social media profiles.&nbsp;pnnnnpSocial media is powerful for building an audience – there’s no doubt about that. But in reality, a website is still the granddaddy of online presence because of its dynamic and highly customizable nature.&nbsp;pnnnnpSocial media platforms will confine you to work within their limitations, which means you will need to adapt your content style to what works best for their algorithms. It can be hard to present a proper biography, an overview of your work, and evergreen content on such platforms.&nbsp;pnnnnpOn the other hand, a website can be whatever you want it to be – you are in full control of the way it looks and functions, and what content is posted.&nbsp;pnnnnpWhether showcasing a portfolio, hosting a blog, or highlighting services, your site is where long-lasting impressions are made, and an essential part of creating an effective website lies in picking the right tools.pnnnnh3 class=wp-block-headingstrongBuild your website on WordPress.comstrongh3nnnnimg width=660 height=378 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1308 nnnnpemWordPress.com homepageempnnnnpa href=httpswordpress.orgWordPress.orga is a href=httpsw3techs.comtechnologiesdetailscm-wordpressthe most popular Content Management Systema (CMS), and it’s used by brands like a href=httpsslack.comSlacka, a href=httpsthewaltdisneycompany.comDisneya, a href=httpsedition.cnn.comCNNa, and a href=httpsabout.meta.comMetaa. If you want to build a site with WordPress, we recommend choosing a href=httpwordpress.comWordPress.coma as your trusted hosting provider, as it comes with built-in security and analytics tools and automatic updates.&nbsp;pnnnnpWith all the technicalities taken care of, you’ll have the time and opportunity to build a great site that fully reflects your personal brand and professional goals.&nbsp;pnnnnpThere are several tiers to WordPress.com, but the a href=httpswordpress.compricingCreator plana is the best option for professionals as it allows you to add unlimited plugins and themes. On the other hand, the integration with a href=httpsjetpack.comJetpacka gives you essential tools to track engagement, monitor traffic sources, and understand your target audience&#8217;s demographics.&nbsp;pnnnnimg width=660 height=429 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-1.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1309 nnnnpemWordPress.com pricingempnnnnpWith the Creator plan, it is very easy to get started, and if you’re serious about personal branding, having unlimited access to plugins and themes will be extremely helpful. Customize to your heart&#8217;s content with design options that resonate with your personal aesthetic, or extend functionality with plugins that offer everything from Search Engine Optimization (SEO) to social media integration.&nbsp;pnnnnpWith its automatic updates, scheduling abilities, and built-in analytics, WordPress.com lets you spend more time creating brand-centric content instead of worrying about admin tasks.&nbsp;pnnnnh3 class=wp-block-headingstrongAdd eCommerce functionality with WooCommercestrongh3nnnnimg width=660 height=330 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-2.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1310 nnnnpemWooCommerce homepageempnnnnpOne of the beautiful things about WordPress is that you can easily turn your website into an online store thanks to a href=httpswoo.comWooCommercea – the eCommerce platform a href=httpsbarn2.comblogwoocommerce-stats#~text=The%20wordpress.org%20plugin%20repository,on%20the%20internet%20use%20WooCommerce.used by more than 4 million websites worldwidea to effectively sell their products and services online!&nbsp;pnnnnpThis interactive commercial platform comes with many useful features, such as the option to add customer reviews to your product, build beautiful and categorized product galleries, upsell and cross-sell products and services, and fully customize product and checkout pages.&nbsp;pnnnnpIf you want to branch out to eCommerce, we recommend opting for the a href=httpswordpress.compricing#~text=power%20of%20WooCommerce.-,Entrepreneur,-Build%20an%20onlineEntrepreneur plana on WordPress.com, as it’s specially developed for people who want a full-fledged online store.&nbsp;pnnnnimg width=660 height=569 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-3.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1311 nnnnpemWordPress.com pricing plansempnnnnh2 class=wp-block-headingstrongBuild a newsletterstrongh2nnnnpEmail marketing is powerful and still very popular among digital marketers. In fact, this marketing strategy is one of the most profitable, with a a href=httpswww.statista.comstatistics804656email-roi-perceptionmind-boggling ROI of $36 for every dollar spenta.&nbsp;pnnnnpEmail gives you a direct line of communication with your audience and builds a longer-lasting relationship, which is especially true with newsletters. A periodic newsletter filled with interesting how-to guides, industry insights, or inspiring success stories not only provides immense value but also bolsters engagement with your brand.&nbsp;pnnnnpWordPress.com includes a a href=httpswordpress.comnewsletternewsletter featurea with every plan, and you can easily include one anywhere on your website by adding a “subscribe” block.&nbsp;pnnnnimg width=660 height=198 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-4.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1312 nnnnpemWordPress subscribe blockempnnnnpThe placement is very important, so we recommend putting this form above the fold on your homepage or as a call to action at the end of a compelling blog post to boost subscription rates.&nbsp;pnnnnimg width=660 height=299 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-5.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1313 nnnnpemExample of placing a subscribe option above the foldempnnnnpThis functionality allows you to convert your blog updates into rich, engaging newsletters. With no cap on the number of emails you can send, WordPress.com hands you the reins to grow your subscriber base unconstrained, unlike other platforms that may restrict your reach.&nbsp;pnnnnpBesides that, it also allows you to create gated content which is a strategy where exclusive content is provided to subscribers. The only thing you need to do is click on “Set up a paid plan” and a new window will pop up, allowing you to fully customize your paid newsletter.&nbsp;pnnnnimg width=660 height=430 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-6.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1314 nnnnpemCreating a paid newsletter with WordPressempnnnnpThis feature on WordPress.com helps you reward and retain your most loyal followers, cementing a strong community around your personal brand.pnnnnh2 class=wp-block-headingstrongUnify your digital presence across all platforms with Gravatarstrongh2nnnnimg width=660 height=403 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-7.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1315 nnnnpemGravatar homepageempnnnnpWhen building your personal brand, you need to think of your online identity as a whole, not as different pieces independent of each other. Build your social media presence and blog as a cohesive online existence, which means syncing your information across platforms.&nbsp;pnnnnpa href=httpsgravatar.comGravatara is an efficient tool that centralizes and streamlines your online identity across the web, powered by your email address.&nbsp;pnnnnpGetting started with Gravatar is quick and user-friendly. With just a few steps, you’ll have a unique avatar that follows you from site to site, attaching a familiar face to your online commentary and interactions.&nbsp;pnnnnimg width=660 height=373 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-8.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1316 nnnnpemExample of a Gravatar profile&nbsp;empnnnnpInstead of adjusting your profile for each platform, you’ll have a consistent identity everywhere, including important and up-to-date details such as contact information and events.&nbsp;pnnnnpA single digital signature allows you to build a consistent online identity, making your personal brand more memorable and credible. By unifying your digital presence, Gravatar alleviates the hassle of managing multiple logins and profiles. This convenience is not only a time-saver but ensures your online identity is uniform and professional.&nbsp;pnnnnpWhen you create your profile, you can fully customize it to fit your needs. Here are some of the great things you can do with Gravatar’s profile editor&nbsp;pnnnnulnliFinetune your profile background with custom colors and images.&nbsp;linulnnnnimg width=660 height=307 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-9.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1317 nnnnpemAdding a custom background image to your Gravatar profileempnnnnulnliConnect your verified social media accounts and other profiles.&nbsp;linulnnnnimg width=660 height=383 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-10.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1318 nnnnpemLinking verified accounts to your Gravatar profileempnnnnulnliAdd customized links to promote blog posts, featured articles, upcoming events, and products.&nbsp;linulnnnnimg width=660 height=429 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-11.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1319 nnnnpemAdding different links to your Gravatar profileempnnnnulnliAdd your contact information so that people can easily get in touch.&nbsp;linulnnnnimg width=660 height=259 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-12.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1320 nnnnpemAdding contact information to your Gravatar profileempnnnnulnliThere is a QR code feature so you can quickly share your profile during networking events or put it on your physical business card.&nbsp;linulnnnnimg width=660 height=385 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-13.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1321 nnnnpemQR code options for Gravatar profilesempnnnnpBesides the QR code, you can also generate a short link to put on your social media accounts, serving as a versatile “Link in bio” landing page.&nbsp;pnnnnh2 class=wp-block-headingstrongLeverage the social media platforms that make sense for your brandstrongh2nnnnpWe won’t go into too much detail about the different social media platforms, as you’re probably already aware of the most popular ones. But we do want to highlight two very important rules&nbsp;pnnnnolnlistrongDon’t worry about being everywhere. Instead, go where your target audience is.strong If you’re building your personal brand as an eCommerce leadership expert, chances are your most loyal audience is on a href=httpswww.linkedin.comLinkedIna rather than a href=httpswww.tiktok.comTikToka or a href=httpswww.instagram.comhl=bgInstagrama. On the other hand, if you’re a creative personality, like an artist or a musician, then social media platforms with a younger demographic would be a better placelinnnnlistrongBe consistent in your posting. strongThis is a universal rule among social media – you won’t be successful if you’re inconsistent with your posting schedule. What helps here is to create a social media calendar and plan out your content for the next month or two.&nbsp;linolnnnnpAnother thing you should remember if you use various platforms is that you want to retain some level of consistency in terms of how you present yourself, and furthermore, it should be easy for people to recognize your personal profile across different profilespnnnnpGravatar can help you maintain this consistency by giving users a constantly updated overview of your professional identity, including a list of verified social media profiles like XTwitter (the official one, not the fish one), TikTok, a href=httpswww.tumblr.comTumblra, Instagram, a href=httpsbsky.socialBlueskya, as well as your personal WordPress website, adding even more credibility. pnnnnh2 class=wp-block-headingstrongOther tools for content creation and sharingstrongh2nnnnpConsistently creating great content is hard! Thankfully, there are plenty of tools to help you out at all stages of the content development process, like the organization and planning, ideation, creation, optimization, and promotion of the final product. With the right tools, you can create a workflow that is tailored to your needs and individual processes, allowing you to be consistent with your production.pnnnnh3 class=wp-block-headingstrongTools for organization and content mappingstrongh3nnnnpa href=httpswww.notion.sointegrationsasanaNotiona and a href=httpsasana.comAsanaa are great for content planning, each offering unique benefits that can result in a more polished and professional brand persona.&nbsp;pnnnnimg width=660 height=403 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-15.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1323 nnnnpemNotion and Asana integrationempnnnnpNotion&#8217;s all-encompassing workspace allows for meticulous planning, crafting, and cataloging of ideas, ensuring a brand&#8217;s narrative unfolds with precision. Asana guides the creative process with its strong project management tools, improving the content production and delivery process.pnnnnpIt&#8217;s worth noting, however, that the richness of features in a href=httpsasana.comappsnotion-asanaNotion and Asanaa comes with a moderate learning curve, but there are many a href=httpsforum.asana.comtmultiple-ways-to-integrate-asana-and-notion-2023-guide482947useful resources by brandsa and other users, a href=httpswww.youtube.comwatchv=g0rYATuSYnIespecially on YouTubea, to help you get used to the tools.&nbsp;pnnnnpThankfully, if you’re already familiar with the Gutenberg WordPress Editor, you shouldn’t have any issues with Notion, as their interfaces are very similar.&nbsp;pnnnnh3 class=wp-block-headingstrongGoogle Trends for ideationstrongh3nnnnimg width=660 height=348 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-16.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1324 nnnnpemGoogle Trends homepageempnnnnpDiving into a href=httpstrends.google.comtrendsGoogle Trendsa&#8216; ocean of insights reveals a highly valuable tool that offers a glimpse into the collective consciousness. By leveraging such data, brands can adjust their content to match audience interests.&nbsp;pnnnnpInterpreting the peaks and valleys of trending topics leads to informed decisions that anchor a content strategy in the present. For instance, a digital marketer might spot an emerging trend in sustainable living and weave this theme into their blog articles, social media posts, and podcasts.pnnnnh3 class=wp-block-headingstrongImage and video editor toolsstrongh3nnnnpAccording to a study by the US Chambers of Commerce, a href=httpsgitnux.orgbranding-statistics#~text=The%20US%20Chamber%20of%20Commerce,recognition%20by%20up%20to%2080%25.55% of first impressions of brands are visuala, which is another proof of how important your visual representation is. It needs to be engaging, unique, and, most importantly, represent your personal values and best qualities.&nbsp;pnnnnpNot everyone is a designer but thankfully, there are tools to help every single professional to create a consistent visual brand. One of the most prominent platforms to do that is a href=httpswww.canva.comen_gbCanvaa, which offers a library of templates, photos, and illustrations that can be customized to align with your personal brand’s visual theme.&nbsp;pnnnnimg width=660 height=348 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-17.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1325 nnnnpemCanva design tool homepageempnnnnpCanva Pro, the premium version, extends these capabilities with additional features like brand kits and background removal, providing an even more tailored design experience.&nbsp;pnnnnpFor people looking to enhance their video editing skills, a href=httpswww.adobe.comproductspremiere-rush.htmlAdobe Premiere Rusha is a free mobile and desktop app that offers various features to help your brand grow. Its built-in camera, for example, allows for high-quality video capture, while intuitive editing tools help edit and share from anywhere, ensuring your visual narrative remains cohesive.&nbsp;pnnnnimg width=660 height=386 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-18.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1326 nnnnpemAdobe Premiere Rush homepageempnnnnpFor budding personal brands, this tool simplifies the creation of professional-looking content that can resonate with audiences across various platforms.pnnnnh3 class=wp-block-headingstrongURL Shortenersstrongh3nnnnpURLs can be very long which makes the process of integrating them troublesome and not aesthetically pleasing. To resolve this, you can use a URL shortener. These are smart tools that allow you to create custom links with your brand name and can also track engagement.&nbsp;pnnnnpA great URL-shortening tool is a href=httpswww.rebrandly.comRebrandlya – an AI platform with more than 100 popular integrations.&nbsp;pnnnnimg width=660 height=507 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-19.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1327 nnnnpemRebrandly homepageempnnnnpIt works by selecting a relevant domain name related to your brand and using it as a consistent base for all your short links. This practice not only reinforces brand visibility but also offers detailed analytics insights to evaluate the effectiveness of your shared content.&nbsp;pnnnnpUsing these analytics can transform raw data into strategic action. By examining click patterns and traffic sources, you can fine-tune your content scheduling and distribution strategies to better capture your audience&#8217;s attention.pnnnnh2 class=wp-block-headingstrongMonitor and refine your results with analytics toolsstrongh2nnnnpBuilding a personal brand is a continuous process, and analytical tools can provide you with helpful performance indicators. These tools clarify which areas of your personal branding strategy are thriving and which require refinement.&nbsp;pnnnnpFor those just starting out on their personal branding journey, focusing on key analytics like engagement rate, follower growth over time, and website conversions can be incredibly insightful.pnnnnpMost social media platforms come with their own analytics dashboards that show metrics such as engagement rates, best-performing content by reach, and follower demographics. These data points highlight which content truly resonates with your audience, informing not only what you create but also how you can create deeper connections. You can then use these insights by experimenting with content types and posting times, and then measure the changes in engagement for continuous improvement.&nbsp;pnnnnpFor example, when open rates for your newsletter seem low, consider AB testing with different subject lines or content structures. Track the subsequent open and click-through rates to identify the most engaging approach, thus maintaining a dynamic and relevant correspondence with your audience.&nbsp;pnnnnpWhen it comes to website analytics, a href=httpsaccounts.google.comsigninv2identifierservice=analytics&passive=1209600&continue=https%3A%2F%2Fanalytics.google.com%2Fanalytics%2Fweb%2F%23&followup=https%3A%2F%2Fanalytics.google.com%2Fanalytics%2Fweb%2F&flowName=GlifWebSignIn&flowEntry=ServiceLoginGoogle Analyticsa is the industry standard. However, for WordPress users, a href=httpsjetpack.comJetpacka offers an accessible alternative and it’s included in both the Creator and Entrepreneur plans with WordPress.com. It provides intuitive metrics such as daily visitors, page views, and top-performing pages, all critical in gauging the traction of your online content without the daunting complexity of Google&#8217;s service.pnnnnimg width=660 height=362 src=httpsblog.gravatar.comwp-contentuploads202404image-20.pngw=660 alt= class=wp-image-1328 nnnnpemJetpack homepageempnnnnpConclude each analysis session with a commitment to apply what you&#8217;ve learned. Set regular intervals for review – be it weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly – to ensure your personal brand remains vibrant and effective. Remember, consistent analysis is a foundational practice that nurtures a strong and resonant personal brand, keeping you one step ahead in the exciting world of online branding.pnnnnh2 class=wp-block-headingstrongCreate a personal brand that stands out with Gravatar&nbsp;strongh2nnnnpCreating and maintaining your personal brand is a lot of work, but don’t be discouraged! My name is Nathan Wrigley.pnnnnpJukebox is a podcast, which is dedicated to all things WordPress. The people, the events, the plugins, the blocks, the themes, and in this case, turning technical know-how into popular content.pnnnnpIf you&#8217;d like to subscribe to the podcast, you can do that by searching for WP Tavern in your podcast player of choice, or by going to wptavern.com forward slash feed forward slash podcast. And you can copy that URL into most podcasts players.pnnnnpIf you have a topic that you&#8217;d like us to feature on the podcast, I&#8217;m keen to hear from you and hopefully get you, or your idea, featured on the show. Head to wptavern.com forward slash contact forward slash jukebox, and use the form there.pnnnnpSo on the podcast today, we have Jamie Marsland.pnnnnpJamie has a varied background in technical corporate leadership, and has been guiding Pootlepress for over a decade. Initially a training service, Pootlepress has become a product focused company known for its WordPress plugins. Jamie&#8217;s depth of experience in the industry is increasingly overshadowed by his visibility as a YouTuber, where, as you&#8217;ll hear, much of his attention is now focused.pnnnnpIn this episode, we&#8217;ll cover some new ground. We talk about a critical issue facing WordPress today, the fierce competition from platforms like Canva and Wix, and the marketing hurdles that WordPress must navigate to maintain its market share.pnnnnpWe also explore Jamie&#8217;s unconventional path to becoming a content creator, discussing how he went from teaching tennis to teaching tech, and how he&#8217;s leveraged YouTube to grow his audience and business. His perspective is that it&#8217;s important to make technical concepts accessible and easy to understand.pnnnnpMaking his content is a lot of work, most of which happens behind the scenes. We get into this a little more deeply, and Jamie shares his strategies for effective video creation, from planning to execution, along with his thoughts on sponsored content and its place in the YouTube ecosystem.pnnnnpIf you&#8217;re curious about the future of WordPress, content creation, or the dynamics of digital learning this episode is for you.pnnnnpIf you&#8217;re interested in finding out more, you can find all of the links in the show notes by heading to wptavern.com forward slash podcast, where you&#8217;ll find all the other episodes as well.pnnnnpAnd so without further delay, I bring you Jamie Marsland.pnnnnpI am joined on the podcast by Jamie Marsland. Hi Jamie.pnnnnp[000308] strongJamie Marslandstrong Hey there. How are youpnnnnp[000310] strongNathan Wrigleystrong Very good. Thank you for joining me today. If you haven&#8217;t checked out what Jamie&#8217;s been doing, Jamie has had a really interesting career in the WordPress space. We&#8217;re going to talk about that. We&#8217;ll talk about his YouTube channel, and how he&#8217;s managed to grow that over the last couple of years. Before we do that Jamie, I wonder if you could introduce yourself, give us your quick WordPress bio.pnnnnp[000329] strongJamie Marslandstrong So quick WordPress bio. I&#8217;ve been running this business, Pootlepress for 14 years. Prior to that though, I had a corporate career in technical, both public businesses and private businesses, running businesses. But always in publishing, and in software publishing. And we started off as a training business, and then we morphed into a product business. Built some plugins, which we still provide. You know, which is like a really interesting idea as a piece of content.pnnnnpSo I&#8217;ve actually found an ethical hacker, he&#8217;s based in Malaga, and I&#8217;m going to go and see him, and that&#8217;ll be part of the video as well. The interesting thing about the sponsorship is how you take an idea and make it interesting, and compelling for people watching the content, so they still want to watch it. That&#8217;s a really creative challenge as well. But in terms of, it hasn&#8217;t changed my opinion yet, but I&#8217;m very early to the financial bit of it.pnnnnp[002621] strongNathan Wrigleystrong Well let&#8217;s hope you still maintain the enthusiasm. What does the process look like then You mentioned that you&#8217;ve come up with some innovative titles, and you&#8217;re obviously telephoning people up, and trying to find hackers here, there, and everywhere. But what is the process, to put out a half an hour, an hour long piece of content Just give us an insight.pnnnnpBecause I think everybody has the impression that, oh, YouTube, it&#8217;s easy. There, he&#8217;s staring at the camera, he&#8217;s talking, he&#8217;s making it up as he goes along. And I&#8217;m sure it&#8217;s not like that. I&#8217;m sure there must be hours, and hours, and hours. What does it take to put out one of your videospnnnnp[002649] strongJamie Marslandstrong As an example, I&#8217;ve got a video coming out today with wordpress.com. It&#8217;s a five minute video and it probably took two days. That sort of magnitude. There&#8217;s like the initial idea, and then I always, always now, get the title and thumbnail sorted first. If anyone&#8217;s going to do this stuff, you&#8217;ve got to do that first with YouTube. It sounds a bit crass, but you&#8217;ve just got to do it. So get the packaging right. And I think only once you&#8217;ve got that right do you know the video&#8217;s going to fly. So that&#8217;s a really good process to go through.pnnnnpAnd then it&#8217;s just around, planning is everything, and the creative idea behind the flow of the video. I&#8217;ve developed a blueprint now, which I use on a lot of my videos, which is about having a hook, and then adding loops into the video, so you keep people engaged throughout the video. So it&#8217;s almost like this layer that you layer on top of a video. So when you&#8217;re seeing the video, you&#8217;re seeing somebody talk about something, but actually there&#8217;s hopefully a blueprint behind it.pnnnnp[002736] strongNathan Wrigleystrong There&#8217;s a story in there somewhere. There&#8217;s a methodology behind it all.pnnnnp[002739] strongJamie Marslandstrong That is getting natural to me now. So when I&#8217;m planning videos, I understand, I don&#8217;t have to think. When you first start doing YouTube, you have to think about everything like that, because it&#8217;s not natural. It is to some people, but it&#8217;s wasn&#8217;t to me. So you&#8217;ve got to plan it, in terms of that blueprint. How to structure it. Hook people at the start, keep them engaged throughout, plus educate them along the journey. So there&#8217;s quite a lot going on.pnnnnp[002758] strongNathan Wrigleystrong Yeah. Do you do sponsor bits inside the video What I mean is, is the sponsorship clearly defined in the content that you do So there&#8217;s an ad for hosting company x, or whatever it may be. And then you get back to being in the video, it&#8217;s Jamie talking to the camera and what have you. Or are you open to creating sponsored videos about particular product or companypnnnnp[002817] strongJamie Marslandstrong So both really. But I&#8217;ve also done videos where I do website recreation, with certain tools. So I&#8217;ve done one with Kadence and GiveWP, where I recreated the Charity Water website using their tools.pnnnnpSo they give me a challenge, and I try and rebuild it using Kadence and their tools. And I did one with Spectra One as well. So that&#8217;s kind of how that works. It kind of varies in a way.pnnnnp[002857] strongNathan Wrigleystrong Okay, so you&#8217;ve got a, you can, approach Jamie if you want to make content.pnnnnp[002901] strongJamie Marslandstrong And I&#8217;ve also got, if you go to my YouTube sponsorship page, I&#8217;ve also got this series of videos going on at the moment where we give my daughters a challenge with a product. We&#8217;ve got five people lined up actually, who have signed up. And the first one we did was Kadence AI. So, can Meg and Lily build a website in 10 minutes, using Kadence AIpnnnnpAnd that&#8217;s another sponsorship opportunity as well. I&#8217;ve got another daughter called Hetty who wants in on the action, she hasn&#8217;t done it yet. Well, you didn&#8217;t mention this bit before, but you know you&#8217;re doing something right when people such as Matt Mullenweg drop your name in the State of the Word. And off the back of, I guess being seen by Matt, you&#8217;re now creating content, or you&#8217;re about to create content.pnnnnp[003011] strongJamie Marslandstrong Yeah, we&#8217;ve done three, fourth one going out today.pnnnnp[003014] strongNathan Wrigleystrong So this is wordpress.com. You&#8217;re making videos in that space. How&#8217;s that process going Are you enjoying thatpnnnnp[003019] strongJamie Marslandstrong Yeah, it&#8217;s great. So it&#8217;s trying to show some of that stuff, but also just kind of speak to the broader market about the cool stuff you can do with WordPress actually.pnnnnpAnd obviously I&#8217;ve got resources of some amazing people in wordpress.com to lean on, in creating content. It&#8217;s kind of like a fabulous thing to happen. So hopefully a video&#8217;s going out in a few hours, which talks about some of the developers you should follow in the WordPress ecosystem. I&#8217;ll ask it, and maybe I&#8217;ll change the wording of it. Do you think there&#8217;s something different about you. Do you think the route to success, in the way that you are doing it with WordPress content, do you think that&#8217;s something you were born with, if you know what I mean Do you have that capacity Were you always able to be a raconteur Can you control the room Have you always had the ability to talk Do you understand kind of where I&#8217;m going Do you believe that this is something that anybody could do with a little bit of hard work and patience, or is there something a bit special about youpnnnnp[003139] strongJamie Marslandstrong There&#8217;s nothing special about me, but there&#8217;s definitely, a lot of my roles in, especially before Pootlepress, were being the communicator between the technical people, and the commercial people. I was that person that could take technical ideas, and then translate them to non-technical people, so they could understand from a business point of view why they were important to do. So I&#8217;ve definitely enjoyed being in that spot, taking really complex ideas, and make simple for people to understand.pnnnnp[003205] strongNathan Wrigleystrong I think it also takes a certain amount courage to push through with something like this. Because the idea of putting things out, and thinking, well, I&#8217;ve made it, people will watch it. That takes a certain level of courage I think, because it&#8217;s easy to think that people will watch it, feel great disappointment if they don&#8217;t. But in your case, it didn&#8217;t turn out that way.pnnnnp[003222] strongJamie Marslandstrong No. We have this running joke with my wife, which is, there&#8217;s three types of people in the world. People that think they&#8217;re worse than they actually are. People think they&#8217;re about right, in terms of their opinion of themself, and people that think they&#8217;re better than they actually are. My wife thinks she&#8217;s slightly worse than, she&#8217;s got far more talent than she thinks she has. I think I&#8217;m probably slightly above, which I think helps in this space.pnnnnp[003244] strongNathan Wrigleystrong I think that&#8217;s great. Thank you for joining me today, Jamie. It&#8217;s been a real pleasure. It&#8217;s been an absolute delight watching your videos, and watching your popularity grow. Let&#8217;s hope that if we were to have the same conversation in 2, 3, 4, 5 years time, it would still be on an upward spike. Let&#8217;s hope that&#8217;s the case. Jamie, thank you for joining me today.pnnnnp[003302] strongJamie Marslandstrong Thanks very much.pndivnnnnpOn the podcast today we have a href=httpswww.youtube.comcJamieMarslandvideosJamie Marslanda.pnnnnpJamie has a varied background in technical corporate leadership, and has been guiding Pootlepress for over a decade. Initially a training service, a href=httpswww.pootlepress.comPootlepressa has become a product-focused company known for its WordPress plugins. Jamie&#8217;s depth of experience in the industry is increasingly overshadowed by his visibility as a YouTuber, where, as you’ll hear, much of his attention is now focussed.pnnnnpIn this episode we cover some new ground. We talk about a critical issue facing WordPress today, the fierce competition from platforms like Canva and Wix, and the marketing hurdles that WordPress must navigate to maintain its market share.pnnnnpWe also explore Jamie&#8217;s unconventional path to becoming a content creator, discussing how he went from teaching tennis to teaching tech, and how he&#8217;s leveraged YouTube to grow his audience and business. His perspective is that it’s important to make technical concepts accessible and easy to understand. Making his content is a lot of work, most of which happens behind the scenes.pnnnnpWe get into this a little more deeply and Jamie shares his strategies for effective video creation, from planning to execution, along with his thoughts on sponsored content and its place in the YouTube ecosystem.pnnnnpIf you’re curious about the future of WordPress, content creation, or the dynamics of digital learning, this episode is for you.pnnnnh2 class=wp-block-headingUseful linksh2nnnnpa href=httpswww.pootlepress.comPootlepressapnnnnpa href=httpswordpress.orgpluginscaxtonCaxtonapnnnnpa href=httpswptavern.compodcast98-marieke-van-de-rakt-on-uniting-the-wordpress-community-for-a-stronger-futureMarieke van de Rakt on Uniting the WordPress Community for a Stronger Futureapnnnnpa href=httpspoststatus.comthe-future-is-open-sourceThe future is open-sourceapnnnnpa href=httpswww.canva.comcanva-createCanva Createap;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s7pubDate;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s31Wed, 10 Apr 2024 140000 +0000;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}}s32httppurl.orgdcelements1.1;a1{s7creator;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s14Nathan Wrigley;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}}}}i7;a6{s4data;s13n	n	n	n	n	n	n;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;s5child;a2{s0;a5{s5title;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s71Akismet reCAPTCHA V2 vs V3 Key Differences (And the Best Alternative);s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s4guid;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s28httpakismet.comp=283843;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s4link;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s44httpsakismet.comblogrecaptcha-v2-vs-v3;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s11description;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s22701pEvery website needs spam protection. If you’re part of an enterprise&#8209;level team, you know the shocking number of resources companies actually have to devote to this. Without some kind of software that helps filter out spam and bot activity, teams might spend more time dealing with fake activity than real&nbsp;visitors.pnnnpa href=httpswww.google.comrecaptchaaboutreCAPTCHAa is one of the most popular options for organizations that want to protect their websites from spam. It’s relatively easy to implement on most websites — you just need to know which version is best for your site.&nbsp;pnnnpHowever, it can disrupt the user experience and provide less&#8209;than&#8209;perfect results. That’s why anti&#8209;spam solutions like a href=httpsakismet.comfeaturesAkismeta (which works completely in the background with AI technology) are quickly becoming the preferred option for organizations looking to streamline the UX and maximize the effectiveness of their online presence. We’ll discuss that option a bit&nbsp;later.pnnnpIn this guide, we’ll introduce you to reCAPTCHA and help you pick the right version for your organization’s needs. We’ll also show you to Akismet, the best reCAPTCHA alternative on the market.&nbsp;pnnnnspan id=more-283843spannnnh2 class=wp-block-headingWhat is&nbsp;reCAPTCHAh2nnpYou’re probably familiar with a CAPTCHA, even if you don’t know it by name. CAPTCHA stands for ‘Completely Automated Public Turing Test to Tell Computers and Humans&nbsp;Apart’.pnnnimg width=1102 height=408 src=httpsakismet.comwp-contentuploads202404image.png alt=reCAPTCHA homepage with information about the tool class=wp-image-283844 nnnnpThat name is a mouthful, but it describes precisely what a CAPTCHA does. It’s a system you can implement a href=httpsakismet.combloghow-to-add-wordpress-contact-formalongside formsa to ensure that only humans can use them. Created at the turn of the 21st century, a basic CAPTCHA simply distorted letters and asked the user to identify them. The technology has continued to evolve over the years and is now known as reCAPTCHA. That’s what we’re looking at today. Google purchased this technology in 2009 and continually works to improve upon it.&nbsp;pnnnpAs a website admin, if there’s a submission that can’t pass a reCAPTCHA test, then you may be dealing with a&nbsp;bot.pnnnpOr a human.&nbsp;pnnnpUnfortunately, as reCAPTCHA has evolved to stay ahead of the ever&#8209;increasing sophistication of bots, the tests have become so complicated that, in many cases, real humans are prevented from using&nbsp;forms.pnnpDespite the potential drawbacks, systems like this are essential in today’s digital landscape. Any popular website deals with huge numbers of spam attacks, including unwelcome comments, a href=httpsakismet.comblogforum-spamfake registrationsa, and login&nbsp;attempts.pnnpQuality reCAPTCHA systems are capable of filtering out many bot submissions. You’ll still need to deal with spam, but in much smaller&nbsp;numbers.pnnpThough not originally invented by the organization, a href=httpswww.google.comrecaptchaabout target=_blank rel=noreferrer noopenerreCAPTCHAa is now a free service (with some limitations for enterprises) that Google provides, and that you can implement for any website or web application. You even get to choose between different versions, depending on the type of protection you want to&nbsp;implement.pnnnimg width=1274 height=546 src=httpsakismet.comwp-contentuploads202404image-1.png alt=reCAPTCHA v3 vs reCAPTCHA v2 class=wp-image-283846 nnnpThese versions offer very different experiences and reCAPTCHA implementations. In the next section, we’ll explore what those differences are, and discuss the evolution from the first version of reCAPTCHA to the current&nbsp;model.pnnh2 class=wp-block-headingThe evolution of reCAPTCHA from V1 to&nbsp;V3h2nnpreCAPTCHA has evolved fairly dramatically since its inception. The changes in how the reCAPTCHA system works reflect new developments in the technology used to combat bots and spam. Let’s take a look at the three major&nbsp;versions.pnnnh3 class=wp-block-headingreCAPTCHA V1h3nnnpThe first version of reCAPTCHA launched in 2007, and it displayed images with distorted textual characters. You can still see this type of CAPTCHA in many places on the web. You’re unable to copy the text, and the letters are heavily distorted to deter programs that might try to analyze the image’s&nbsp;contents.pnnnimg width=760 height=294 src=httpsakismet.comwp-contentuploads202404image-2.png alt=CAPTCHA with instructions on entering two words class=wp-image-283847 nnnpThis type of CAPTCHA also fulfilled a secondary purpose. A lot of the images of text were taken from digitized books. If you resolved this type of CAPTCHA, you not only proved that you’re human, but you also helped software better recognize the language in digitized&nbsp;books.pnnpOverall, this is the most straightforward type of reCAPTCHA you can implement for your organization. It’s relatively easy for most people to solve (as CAPTCHAs should be). However, it’s also become outdated over&nbsp;time.pnnpThese days, there’s plenty of software and bots that are sophisticated enough to recognize the letters that images contain. That means reCAPTCHA V1 is no longer an effective&nbsp;option.pnnnh3 class=wp-block-headingreCAPTCHA V2h3nnnnpreCAPTCHA V2 is where Google stepped in. They acquired the software in 2009 and launched V2 in 2014.&nbsp;pnnnpThis version of reCAPTCHA offered a emvery emdifferent experience from anything else on the market. Instead of having visitors solve a puzzle to prove they’re human, reCAPTCHA V2 shows a simple checkbox that says, “I am not a&nbsp;robot”.pnnnimg width=948 height=566 src=httpsakismet.comwp-contentuploads202404image-3.png alt=reCAPTCHA with a checkbox for I am not a robot class=wp-image-283848 nnnpAs an end user, all you have to do is click on the checkbox. reCAPTCHA V2 analyzes the user behavior during that process, and only presents further challenges if the system suspects it’s dealing with a&nbsp;bot.pnnpThose subsequent challenges typically involve image recognition tasks. reCAPTCHA V2 might ask you to select all the images that contain a specific element, like vehicles or&nbsp;stairs.pnnnimg width=874 height=634 src=httpsakismet.comwp-contentuploads202404image-4.png alt=grid of images to review class=wp-image-283849 nnnpThe goal of these changes was to make CAPTCHAs more user&#8209;friendly. reCAPTCHA V1 is often frustrating for visitors, since it’s easy to mistake some of the characters shown in the&nbsp;images.pnnpIn other words, visitors often needed multiple tries to resolve a V1 reCAPTCHA. With V2, some visitors will still need to solve rote verification challenges, but most can just check a box and&nbsp;proceed.pnnnh3 class=wp-block-headingreCAPTCHA V3h3nnnpV3 is the latest version of reCAPTCHA and the current industry standard. It launched in 2018, and it offers human verification that works entirely in the background of a&nbsp;website.pnnpWith reCAPTCHA V3, visitors don’t need to solve any challenges or tick any verification boxes. The software analyzes user behavior and gives each visitor a score. Depending on the score, it can determine whether a visitor is a human or a&nbsp;bot.pnnpAs the administrator, you can lower or raise the threshold for human verification with reCAPTCHA V3. The software gives you control over how strict it is, and whether it should completely block traffic it deems to be from&nbsp;bots.pnnpOverall, reCAPTCHA V3 is better from a user&#8209;experience standpoint. Instead of forcing visitors to interact with a CAPTCHA system or solve random challenges, V3 simply analyzes their behavior behind the scenes. A human visitor may be locked out if they are incorrectly determined to be a bot, but this should be rare (depending on your chosen&nbsp;settings).pnnh2 class=wp-block-headingUnderstanding reCAPTCHA&nbsp;V2h2nnpThese days, it doesn’t make sense to use reCAPTCHA V1, whether it’s for a small business or an enterprise&#8209;level website. That version of the software is deprecated, which means your choice will be between V2 and V3 (or a completely different&nbsp;alternative).pnnpreCAPTCHA V2 aims to minimize the number of visitors who need to solve challenges to prove they’re human. With V2, most visitors will only see a simple checkbox they need to tick to prove that they’re not&nbsp;bots.pnnpThis can seem like a rudimentary approach, but it works because V2 also analyzes user behavior in the background. If it sees suspicious activity, it will also ask visitors to resolve visual&nbsp;challenges.pnnpIn practice, only a small number of human visitors should be presented with those additional challenges. This can be a safer approach than using a CAPTCHA system that works fully in the background because it provides a second chance for humans falsely labeled as robots. Plus, it doesn’t allow the site admin to reduce the level of strictness, as is the case for&nbsp;V3.pnnnpThe downside of reCAPTCHA V2 is that it will inconvenience visitors in some cases. However, presenting challenges can also help to keep your organization’s website safer.&nbsp;pnnnpAside from the occasional annoyance for visitors, versions of reCAPTCHA that rely on visual challenges can present accessibility issues. reCAPTCHA offers audio versions of its challenges for visitors with visual impairments, but the system is not&nbsp;perfect.pnnnpGoogle provides support for a href=httpsdevelopers.google.comrecaptchadocsdisplay target=_blank rel=noreferrer noopenerimplementing reCAPTCHA V2a on your website using JavaScript. It’s worth noting that while the service is free, it only supports up to one million assessments per month.&nbsp;pnnnpIf you do require additional assessments, you’ll need to budget for a a href=httpscloud.google.comrecaptcha-enterprisepricingreCAPTCHA Enterprisea&nbsp;plan.pnnh2 class=wp-block-headingUnderstanding reCAPTCHA&nbsp;V3h2nnpreCAPTCHA V3 is the latest version of the CAPTCHA software. It does away with human verification challenges, and instead uses a score system that works entirely in the&nbsp;background.pnnpWhen you implement reCAPTCHA V3 to protect a form, it automatically analyzes the behavior of any user who tries to access it. The software uses an algorithm to determine if a visitor is a human or a bot, by scoring them using specific&nbsp;criteria.pnnpThe approach of V3 is completely different from previous versions of the software. You can calibrate the scoring system for your site to decide what is an acceptable threshold for determining ‘human behavior’, and block traffic the system thinks is&nbsp;suspicious.pnnpThis version of the software offers the most user&#8209;friendly implementation of CAPTCHA. That’s because visitors don’t need to deal with challenges or interact with any elements to prove that they’re&nbsp;human.pnnpThe downside of this approach is that it can lead to more false negatives. No bot detection system is perfect, and without challenges, your organization might end up dealing with more spam&nbsp;submissions.pnnpIn terms of integration, you can a href=httpsdevelopers.google.comrecaptchadocsv3implement reCAPTCHA V3a on your website using JavaScript. The code is different from V2, and you get a lot of control over how the implementation works and how sensitive it is when it comes to scoring user&nbsp;behavior.pnnh2 class=wp-block-headingChoosing between reCAPTCHA V2 and&nbsp;V3h2nnpAny organization with a significant online presence needs some sort of protection against spam and bot activity. reCAPTCHA V2 and V3 are among the most popular options because they’re relatively easy to implement, and they have generous free&nbsp;plans.pnnpUsing V3 might seem like the logical option, since it’s the latest version of the reCAPTCHA software. In practice, though, V2 continues to be an incredibly popular version of the&nbsp;software.pnnpBoth V2 and V3 provide comprehensive protection from spam for your website, but they do it using two different approaches. Despite being older, V2 offers a more secure experience, since it still implements a challenge system for suspicious&nbsp;visitors.pnnpV3, on the other hand, can be more prone to false positivesnegatives. Since you can configure what the software does if it detects suspicious activity, there’s more room for potential human error during the implementation&nbsp;process.pnnpOverall, reCAPTCHA V2 offers a more secure experience that is ideal for sensitive forms. If you have forms dealing with sensitive user data, having the option to present challenges can help you avoid problems like fake ecommerce&nbsp;orders.pnnpreCAPTCHA V3 can be incredibly effective, but it prioritizes user experience over higher levels of security. This makes it a better option for less sensitive forms and user submissions, such as comments&nbsp;sections.pnnpYou emcan emconfigure reCAPTCHA V3 to be more strict in detecting bot activity. The downside of this approach is that it can increase the rate of false positives. If you use reCAPTCHA to block bot traffic, and it mistakes a human visitor for a fake one, they’re unlikely to be happy with the&nbsp;experience.pnnpUltimately, there is no single best version of reCAPTCHA. You’ll need to consider the relative strengths and weaknesses of each one to determine which is most appropriate for your website. (There are also alternative tools you can use, which we’ll discuss&nbsp;shortly.)pnnpWhen it comes time to implement one of these systems, Google provides plenty of useful documentation for both reCAPTCHA V2 and V3. Your organization can set either one up manually, or via plugins if you use a content management system (CMS) like&nbsp;WordPress.pnnpBoth versions of reCAPTCHA are free for up to one million validations per&nbsp;month.pnnh2 class=wp-block-headingExploring the alternatives to&nbsp;reCAPTCHAh2nnpreCAPTCHA is not the only option at your disposal. If you’re not happy with the approach that either V2 or V3 uses, then it’s smart to consider a href=httpsakismet.comblogcaptcha-alternativesalternatives to CAPTCHA technologya for your spam&nbsp;protection.pnnpWhile there are a variety of anti&#8209;spam solutions available, a href=httpsakismet.comfeaturesAkismeta is the only one that rivals reCAPTCHA in terms of how easy it is to implement emandem its success rate. With Akismet, you get bot protection with 99.99%&nbsp;accuracy.pnnnimg width=1243 height=846 src=httpsakismet.comwp-contentuploads202404image-5.png alt=stats about Akismet's success class=wp-image-283850 nnnpMore importantly, Akismet doesn’t rely on challenges to separate humans from bots. It offers a solution that works in the background to protect your website from spam, and it provides a fully free plan for personal websites and&nbsp;blogs.pnnpFor professional websites, a href=httpsakismet.compricingthere’s flexible pricinga. Small businesses can get the protection they need via the Pro plan for just $9.95 per month (when billed yearly). For a href=httpsakismet.comenterpriseenterprise&#8209;level spam protectiona, organizations can get plans and pricing that’s customized around their specific&nbsp;needs.pnnh2 class=wp-block-headingAkismet The leader in spam&nbsp;protectionh2nnpNo matter which spam protection solution you choose for your organization, it needs to fulfill two key criteria. The first is to protect you against as much spam and bot activity as possible, with the fewest false positives along the way. The second is to protect a strong user&nbsp;experience.pnnpThe importance of that user experience can’t be discounted. Some CAPTCHA solutions, like reCAPTCHA V2, are aggressive when it comes to presenting challenges after they detect suspicious activity. In some cases, reCAPTCHA V2 can force visitors to solve multiple challenges before giving them the green&nbsp;light.pnnpThat aggressive approach to spam detection can keep your website safe. The downside is that it can scare visitors away because solving multiple CAPTCHAs is not an enjoyable&nbsp;experience.pnnpa href=httpsakismet.comblogconvertkit-customerstoryAkismet solves this problema by providing behind&#8209;the&#8209;scenes detection based on machine learning. It analyzes data from real spam on over 100 million websites to provide the most accurate detection&nbsp;possible.pnnnimg width=1126 height=628 src=httpsakismet.comwp-contentuploads202404image-6.png alt=Aksimet page with the text  nnnpAkismet provides simple integration with all kinds of websites, and it’s particularly easy to implement if you’re using WordPress. Your website administrator can a href=httpswordpress.orgpluginsakismet target=_blank rel=noreferrer noopenerinstall the Akismet plugina, activate it, and start filtering spam right&nbsp;away.pnnnimg width=1097 height=508 src=httpsakismet.comwp-contentuploads202404image-7.png alt=Akismet plugin listing class=wp-image-283852 nnnpAlthough Akismet filters spam and bot activity in the background, you can also check to make sure it doesn’t flag any real submissions as spam. This is rare, but it sometimes happens, and Akismet learns from these situations to avoid flagging similar activity in the&nbsp;future.pnnh2 class=wp-block-headingFrequently asked&nbsp;questionsh2nnpIf you still have any questions about spam protection and what solutions to consider, this section will aim to answer them. Let’s start by recapping the key elements of&nbsp;reCAPTCHA.pnnh3 class=wp-block-headingWhat is&nbsp;reCAPTCHAh3nnpreCAPTCHA is a CAPTCHA solution offered by Google. You can choose from reCAPTCHA V2 or V3 for your website, and implement either option using&nbsp;JavaScript.pnnpBoth versions of the software offer unique approaches to how they protect your website from spam. You can use either version for free for up to one million validations per&nbsp;month.pnnh3 class=wp-block-headingWhat is the primary goal of reCAPTCHA in website&nbsp;securityh3nnpThe primary goal of reCAPTCHA is to stop spam form submissions. That includes spam comments, brute&#8209;force attacks through login screens, fake payment information, and other types of&nbsp;attacks.pnnpThe software does this by helping to distinguish between real interactions on a website and bots. Different versions of reCAPTCHA use unique approaches to achieve this&nbsp;protection.pnnh3 class=wp-block-headingHow have CAPTCHA mechanisms evolved over the years, leading up to reCAPTCHA V2 and&nbsp;V3h3nnpOver time, CAPTCHA mechanisms have evolved to rely less on challenges and more on behind&#8209;the&#8209;scenes analysis. With reCAPTCHA V1, visitors were forced to solve challenges to prove they were human. Whereas the newest version of the software (V3) analyzes behavior without any input required from&nbsp;visitors.pnnh3 class=wp-block-headingCan bots still bypass reCAPTCHA systems And if so, how do newer versions mitigate&nbsp;thish3nnpCAPTCHA systems are always in a race to stay ahead of newer, stronger bots. There’s a community of malicious actors who work to bypass reCAPTCHA protections, as well as other similar systems. This is because a href=httpsakismet.comblogwhat-is-a-spambotspambotsa and automated attacks can be incredibly lucrative, and there’s significant interest in programs that can bypass well&#8209;known&nbsp;CAPTCHAs.pnnpNewer versions mitigate this risk through continued development. Any CAPTCHA solution you choose needs to get regular updates to both the core software and its spam database, in order to stay ahead of attackers. If the solution you’re using doesn’t do this, it will quickly become&nbsp;outdated.pnnh3 class=wp-block-headingCan I use reCAPTCHA V2 and V3 simultaneously for added&nbsp;securityh3nnpYes, you can use reCAPTCHA V2 and V3 on the same website to protect different pages and assets. Google includes information on how to implement both versions of reCAPTCHA in its developer&nbsp;handbook.pnnh3 class=wp-block-headingWhat is the best alternative to&nbsp;reCAPTCHAh3nnpAkismet offers the best alternative to reCAPTCHA for both small business websites and enterprise&#8209;level projects. You can easily implement Akismet on any type of website, but it’s particularly easy to do so if your organization uses&nbsp;WordPress.pnnh3 class=wp-block-headingHow does Akismet’s approach to spam protection differ from traditional CAPTCHA&nbsp;methodsh3nnpAkismet uses machine learning to analyze spam from the millions of websites that use it. This gives it access to one of the largest databases in the world for spam and bot activity, which means fewer false&nbsp;positives.pnnpWith Akismet, visitors also don’t need to solve challenges to prove they’re human. The software can analyze their submissions and use its training to determine what’s spam and what&nbsp;isn’t.pnnh2 class=wp-block-headingAkismet The most trusted solution for spam&nbsp;protectionh2nnnpIf you’re looking for the easiest solution to implement with the most accurate results and absolutely zero interference for your visitors, your best choice is Akismet. It’s blocked over 500 billion instances of spam and is used on over 100 million sites.&nbsp;pnnnpreCAPTCHA offers some additional customization, but also comes with risks like false positives that lock out real users and an annoying experience that could reduce your conversions. You can integrate Akismet with any system via an open API, or take advantage of its popular, pre&#8209;built plugin for WordPress&nbsp;sites.pnnnpMany website owners can use Akismet absolutely free. a href=httpsakismet.compricingExplore Akismet plansa.&nbsp;p;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s7pubDate;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s31Wed, 10 Apr 2024 130000 +0000;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}}s32httppurl.orgdcelements1.1;a1{s7creator;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s11Jen Swisher;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}}}}i8;a6{s4data;s13n	n	n	n	n	n	n;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;s5child;a2{s0;a5{s5title;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s86Do The Woo Community Leveraging WooCommerce for Wyrmwood Gaming with Douglas Costello;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s4guid;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s28httpsdothewoo.iop=81053;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s4link;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s85httpsdothewoo.ioleveraging-woocommerce-for-wyrmwood-gaming-with-douglas-costello;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s11description;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s123The Woo team and Douglas discuss Wyrmwood's journey, Kickstarter success, challenges of growth, and multi-channel commerce.;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s7pubDate;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s31Wed, 10 Apr 2024 094900 +0000;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}}s32httppurl.orgdcelements1.1;a1{s7creator;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s5BobWP;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}}}}i9;a6{s4data;s13n	n	n	n	n	n	n;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;s5child;a2{s0;a5{s5title;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s41Donncha Speculating on what to load next;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s4guid;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s28httpsodd.blogp=89590546;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s4link;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s61httpsodd.blog20240410speculating-on-what-to-load-next;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s11description;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s1974pThe a href=httpswordpress.orgpluginsspeculation-rulesSpeculative Loadinga plugin for WordPress is a plugin you should probably try out on your site, especially if you use a href=httpswordpress.orgpluginswp-super-cacheWP Super Cachea or a href=httpswordpress.orgpluginsjetpack-boostJetpack Boosta to cache things. It uses the new speculation API that ChromeEdge supports to load pages in the background if you even hover over a link.pnnnnpIt will dynamically prefetch or prerender pages before they&#8217;re requested by the visitor on your site, which means that the page will show instantly when the visitor actually clicks the link.pnnnnpIt doesn&#8217;t work in Firefox yet, but it won&#8217;t hurt either, as the browser will just ignore the extra bits and pieces added to the page.pnnnnpThe default &#8220;moderate&#8221; eagerness works fine for me. The &#8220;eager&#8221; setting appeared to load links if the cursor got anywhere near them, which was a little too aggressive.pnnnnpYou won&#8217;t notice your browser loading the page in the Network tab of the webdev tools, but if you codetailcode your access_log, you&#8217;ll see the requests go through when you hover over the links.pnnnnpBrowse around this site, or take a look at my a href=httpsinphotos.orgphotobloga for a feel of what it does.pnnnnpThere&#8217;s more info in the a href=httpsmake.wordpress.orgcore20240409speculative-loading-in-wordpressmake blog posta about it, and this a href=httpsmake.wordpress.orgcore20240409speculative-loading-in-wordpress#comment-46522insightful commenta about the wastefulness of loading pages that might not be used, especially for visitors on limited data plans, or low powered devices. That&#8217;s definitely something to think about before using this plugin. I may yet remove it later, and I&#8217;ll update this post if I do.pnnnnpp;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s7pubDate;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s31Wed, 10 Apr 2024 094328 +0000;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}}s32httppurl.orgdcelements1.1;a1{s7creator;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s7Donncha;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}}}}i10;a6{s4data;s13n	n	n	n	n	n	n;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;s5child;a2{s0;a5{s5title;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s24Matt Beeper &amp; Texts;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s4guid;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s23httpsma.ttp=113285;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s4link;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s35httpsma.tt202404beeper-texts;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s11description;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s1124pIt&#8217;s such a delight when a plan comes together and unfolds, especially when it&#8217;s something you&#8217;ve been working on for many years. Today the a href=httpsautomattic.com20240409automattic-acquires-beeperannouncement went outa that we&#8217;re combining the best technology from Beeper and Texts to create a great private, secure, and open source messaging client for people to have control of their communications. We&#8217;re going to use the Beeper brand, because it&#8217;s fun. This is not unlike how browsers have evolved, where solid tech and encryption on top of an open ecosystem has created untold value for humanity. a href=httpsblog.beeper.com20240409beeper-is-joining-automatticEric Migicovsky has written well about the plan going forwarda.pnnnnpA lot of people are asking about iMessage on Android&#8230; I have zero interest in fighting with Apple, I think instead it&#8217;s best to focus on messaging networks that want more engagement from power-user clients. This is an area I&#8217;m excited to work on when I return from my sabbatical next month.p;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s7pubDate;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s31Wed, 10 Apr 2024 000055 +0000;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}}s32httppurl.orgdcelements1.1;a1{s7creator;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s4Matt;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}}}}i11;a6{s4data;s13n	n	n	n	n	n	n;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;s5child;a2{s0;a5{s5title;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s68WordPress.org blog WordPress 6.5.2 Maintenance and Security Release;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s4guid;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s35httpswordpress.orgnewsp=17195;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s4link;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s84httpswordpress.orgnews202404wordpress-6-5-2-maintenance-and-security-release;s7attribs;a0{}s8xml_base;s0;s17xml_base_explicit;b0;s8xml_lang;s0;}}s11description;a1{i0;a5{s4data;s4851pstrongNote Due to an issue with the initial package, WordPress 6.5.1 was not released. 6.5.2 is the first minor release for WordPress 6.5.strongpnnnnpThis security and maintenance release features a href=httpscore.trac.wordpress.orgquerystatus=closed&id=!60398&milestone=6.5.2&group=status&order=priority2 bug fixes on Corea, a href=httpsgithub.comWordPressgutenbergpull6057712 bug fixes for the Block Editora, and 1 security fix.pnnnnpstrongBecause this is a security release, it is recommended that you update your sites immediately.strong Backports are also available for other major WordPress releases, 6.0 and later.pnnnnpYou can a href=httpswordpress.orgwordpress-6.5.2.zipdownload WordPress 6.5.2 from WordPress.orga, or visit your WordPress Dashboard, click “Updates”, and then click “Update Now”. If you have sites that support automatic background updates, the update process will begin automatically.pnnnnpWordPress 6.5.2 is a short-cycle release. The next major release will be a href=httpsmake.wordpress.orgcore6-6version 6.6a and is currently planned for 16 July 2024.pnnnnh2 class=wp-block-headingSecurity updates included in this releaseh2nnnnpThe security team would like to thank the following people for responsibly reporting vulnerabilities, and allowing them to be fixed in this releasepnnnnulnliA cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability affecting the Avatar block type; reported by a href=httpsjohnblackbourn.comJohn Blackbourna of the WordPress security team. The Woo Community Increase Your Woo Product Sales Using Admin Demos with Vikas
